706471f-a.title: Brooklyn: Remsen Street - Clinton Street
706471f-a.text:
Remsen Street, west from Clinton Street. In the left foreground is the Hamilton Club, organized on November 2, 1830 as the Young Nen's Literary Association; changing its name in October 1831 to the Hamilton Literary Association of Hrooklyn. Henry C. Murphy became its first president. Ninety of these members founded the present club which was incorporated in May 1882. The first quarters of the organization were in the Hamilton Puilding, at the N.W. corner of Court and Joralemon Streets, now the Temple Bar Building. In 1884 its present site was purchased at a cost of e:9,000. The Clubhouse cost another551,000, The statue of Alexander Hamilton was erected in 1892. Also partially seen are the Church of the Pilgrias an d
the Eotel Bossert.
1922.
gugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706471f-a.folder: Remsen Street & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY

703676f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clinton Street - Remsen Street
703676f-a.text:
Clinton Street, east side, from Remsen to Livingston Streets. (Joralemon Street, is in the center of the view). In the left background, is
St. Ann's P.E. Church.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703676f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Remsen Street, Brooklyn, NY

706470f-a.title: Brooklyn: Remsen Street - Clinton Street
706470f-a.text:
Remsen Street, north side, west from Clinton Street. In center at
right, is a view of the Church of the Pilgrims.
August 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706470f-a.folder: Remsen Street & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY

706474f-a.title: Brooklyn: Remsen Street - Clinton Street
706474f-a.text:
180 Remsen Street, south side, between Clinton and Court Streets,
showing the Brooklyn Union Gas Co.. Building.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

703658f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clinton Street - Remsen Street
703658f-a.text:
Clinton Street, west side, at and south of Remsen Street, showing the
demolition of building. at the S.W. corner.
December 15, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
703658f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Remsen Street, Brooklyn, NY

706464f-b.title: Brooklyn: Remsen Street - Clinton Street
706464f-b.text:
(1).
Remsen Street, north side, west from Clinton and beyond Henry Streets. COngregational Church of the Pilgrim's is seen in the center.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same; from a more distant point nearer to Clinton Street.
March 1, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

706469f-b.title: Brooklyn: Remsen Street - Clinton Street
706469f-b.text:
(1)
Remsen Street, at the S.E. corner of Clinton Street, showing the
Spencer Memorial Presbyterian Church.
February 22, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same; fro another angle, showing also the Hamilton Club, at
the S.W. corner of Remsen and Clinton Streets.
September 9, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, a further view of Clinton Street.
May 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
